topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e55fd6368726f16e50100#post_547e55fd6368726f16e50100
IKR? It's that one thing you have such a trouble finding balance in, I tried being non conformist, but my family kept trying to make me conform because I didn't really dress or act the way they wanted me to. Though that part about dressing isn't really my fault. 

There's a fine line to follow, I act courteous but not disrespectful to others, and I don't show respect to people who haven't either earned it or deserve it. Which has put me at odds with people in the past, and family too.

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e56bb6368727a9fdf0200#post_547e56bb6368727a9fdf0200

The second paragraph, I genuinely approve. I have problems with that too.

It's the first were the main issue lies. There's a difference between being a non-comformist (I got a book, why leave it like that if I can use it to draw/write and so on), and like to play captain contrarian.

Being a non-comformist means you take nothing for granted and exploit everything you can get your hands on for a benefit.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e56806368724d6f8c0000#post_547e56806368724d6f8c0000
She had her moments when she did better, though I do admit they really botched the whole universe with that random sh*it where they end up on some world which controls the entire force for some damn reason. 

How the heck that even works I don't know, but it's supposedly what makes Anikin even darker or something, I really have no idea how they even fit that stupid arc into the series. I think they really screwed everything up in later seasons. 

Also the Mandalorians are now all people of Caucasian descent, who apparently have given up most of their militaristic traits for being all good and gracious. I hate that part because they got rid of all the baddass Maori warrior like image that was built up from comics and so forth, they were really awesome.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e57726368720762a00200#post_547e57726368720762a00200
Huh, I think my interpretation of non-conformism is kind of different. I mean I'm not necessarily like that, I care about people enough to help, though I'm not sure when it's the most appropriate thing to do. 

I am selfish at times, I admit it, but I do try to avoid being an asshole outright without reason, I've got my own reasons for what I do. I'm not a hundred percent sure, but I think I'm on a different line here. Dunno, I don't read many books on sociology and so forth. So can't really judge.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e562c6368727b7ab90200#post_547e562c6368727b7ab90200
Force = Mass * Acceleration
2341500 newtons = 101500 kilograms * 223 m/s
or 449617.886 pounds of force.

Basically you would need the equivalent of over a thousand Boeing 777 aircraft jet engines just to move it.

I stand corrected; you wouldn't need a fusion reactor to generate the energy, just a fission reactor *BUT* the amount of force needed to move it is totally unviable.



Also do you even understand how rail guns work?  Rail guns are already in action, but the way they work is that they store a charge over time and then release it.



Honestly I have to massively disagree with how scifi depicts space travel, cause the amount of energy needed to move a spaceship the size of a aircraft carrier near light speed in insane.  Personally if you ask me the way interstellar space travel will work is that it'll be spaceships the size of a fridge or single bed in which the conciousness of people are stored rather than actually transporting all that material so as to require far less energy.

Benefit: Anywhere from self satisfaction to altruism.

Optional Benefit: The knowing of having done something out of proper decisions, rather than have it imposed by someone or out of obligation.

"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e5b0363687238df0c0000#post_547e5b0363687238df0c0000
My thoughts on conformity vs nonconformity in a nutshell:
Just be happy with yourself.

Some people are happy being stay at home parents who wear conservative clothing, go to church every sunday, only have sex for procreation and cook dinner; some people are happy being screamo singers who wear next to no clothing, are levyists(what people think of when they hear "satanism"; "satanism" is just a polytheistic religion that they called themselves that to piss off christians), have constant orgies and always eat out.

So long as you are happy with yourself.
